title: Gaze Prediction and Dataset Development
description: Developing comprehensive datasets and machine learning models for predicting human gaze patterns in accessibility applications. Focus on improving assistive technologies through advanced computer vision techniques.
contributions: Designed and implemented data collection protocols for gaze tracking experiments
Developed CNN + BiGRU hybrid architecture for temporal gaze prediction
Created comprehensive dataset with over 10,000 annotated gaze sequences
Optimized model performance achieving 92% accuracy in gaze direction prediction
outcomes: Improved gaze prediction accuracy by 15% over baseline models
Dataset prepared for publication and open-source release
Research findings to be presented at accessibility conference

title: Natural Language Processing for Environmental Applications
description: Research focused on developing advanced NLP systems for environmental monitoring and awareness. Implemented transformer-based models and conversational AI for environmental data interpretation and user engagement.
contributions: Implemented LSTM and transformer architectures for environmental text analysis
Developed VayuBuddy chatbot using HuggingFace transformers and LangChain
Created comprehensive evaluation framework for conversational AI systems
Integrated real-time environmental data APIs with natural language interfaces
outcomes: Successfully deployed VayuBuddy chatbot with 95% user satisfaction rate
Research methodology adopted for future environmental AI projects
Contributed to lab's publication on environmental NLP applications
